Disclaimer.text1: While we strive to provide accurate and up-to-date information on our website, we cannot guarantee the complete accuracy or reliability of the content. The information provided is intended for general informational purposes only and should not be considered professional advice.
Disclaimer.text2: We are not responsible for any errors, omissions, or inaccuracies in the content, nor for any losses or damages arising from reliance on the information presented. It is your responsibility to verify any information before making decisions based on it.
Disclaimer.text3: Please note that our services may not be suitable for everyone. We recommend consulting with a professional for specific advice tailored to your needs.
Disclaimer.text4: By using our website, you agree to these terms and conditions.

PrivacyPolicy.preamble: {entity} is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information when you visit our website or interact with our services.

item1.title: Personal Information
item1.text: When you create an account or contact us, we may collect your name, email address, and password.

item2.title: Usage Data
item2.text: We may collect information about how you interact with our website, such as your IP address, browser type, and pages visited.

item1.title: Authentication
item1.text: We use your information to authenticate your access to our website and services

item2.title: Communication
item2.text: We may use your contact information to respond to inquiries or provide updates.

item3.title: Analytics
item3.text: We may use usage data to improve our website and services.

item1.title: Third-Party Service Providers
item1.text: We may share your personal information with third-party service providers who help us operate our website and services (e.g., for authentication, email delivery).

item2.title: Legal Requirements
item2.text: We may disclose your information to comply with legal obligations or to protect our rights.

data_security.title: Data Security
data_security.text1: We implement reasonable security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, loss, or alteration.

your_rights.title: Your Rights
your_rights.text1: You have the right to access, rectify, or erase your personal data.
your_rights.text2: You can exercise these rights by contacting us at {email}

cookies_and_tracking.title: Cookies and Tracking
cookies_and_tracking.text1: We use cookies to enhance your user experience and collect usage data. You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings.

third_party_services.title: Third-Party Services
third_party_services.text1: We may use third-party services that collect and process personal information. Please refer to the privacy policies of these services for more details.

childrens_privacy.title: Children's Privacy
childrens_privacy.text1: Our website is not intended for children under the age of {age}. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.

changes_to_this_policy.title: Changes to This Policy
changes_to_this_policy.text1: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any significant changes by posting the updated policy on our website.

Headers.any_questions: If you have any questions, our talented artists will be more than happy to assist you, and all consultations are free.

question1.title: How do I make an appointment for a tattoo?
question1.description: Send us a message via contact form or WhatsApp button. Text us your idea so we can connect it with the right artist and you only have to explain it once.

question2.title: Do I need to bring in my design for the tattoo I want?
question2.description: You are welcome to bring in a design as a reference, however our artists may suggest redesigning it for better results. If you only have ideas, consult with an artist, and they will create a custom drawing for you. To begin the drawing process, a deposit fee (amount varies) and an appointment must be arranged.

question3.title: Does getting a tattoo hurt?
question3.description: Yes, getting a tattoo can be painful, but pain tolerance varies among individuals. Certain body parts may be more sensitive than others, such as ribs, elbow, knee, wrist, spine, and back of the knee.

question4.title: Do you provide tattoo removal services?

question5.title: How do I prepare for my tattoo appointment?
question5.description: Get a good night's sleep, eat a healthy meal beforehand (avoid alcohol and excessive caffeine), and wear comfortable, loose clothing that allows easy access to the area being tattooed. Stay hydrated. If you have any medical conditions or are taking medications, inform your artist.

question6.title: What should I bring to my appointment?
question6.description: Bring a valid photo ID, any reference images you have for your design, and a snack or drink if you're having a longer session.  You can also bring entertainment like a book or headphones.

question7.title: What happens during the tattoo process?
question7.description: Your artist will prepare the area by cleaning and sometimes shaving it. They'll then apply a stencil of your design. Once you approve the placement, they'll begin tattooing. You can take breaks as needed.

question8.title: How long will my tattoo session last?
question8.description: This depends on the size and complexity of the design. Your artist can give you an estimate during the consultation.

question9.title: How do I care for my new tattoo?
question9.description: Your artist will provide you with specific aftercare instructions. Generally, this involves keeping the tattoo clean and moisturized. Avoid soaking the tattoo in water (baths, swimming) and protect it from sun exposure. Read our Day After section of FAQ for more details.

question10.title: What is the healing process like?
question10.description: The healing process typically takes 2-4 weeks.  You may experience some redness, swelling, and itching.  Do not pick at the scabs.

question1.title: What happens during the piercing process?
question1.description: We will confirm your chosen piercing and placement. The area will be thoroughly cleaned and prepped.  We will use sterile, single-use needles and high-quality jewelry.  The piercing will be performed quickly and efficiently.

question2.title: How long does it take for a piercing to heal?
question2.description: The healing time for piercings varies depending on the location. For more information, please refer to our piercing aftercare section.

question3.title: Is getting a piercing safe?
question3.description: Yes, when performed in a reputable studio with sterile equipment and proper hygiene practices. Our studio is licensed and follows strict sterilization protocols. We use autoclave sterilization for all reusable equipment.

question4.title: What kind of jewelry is used?
question4.description: We offer a variety of high-quality jewelry options, including implant-grade titanium, surgical steel, and gold. We will discuss the best options for your piercing and any allergies you may have.

question5.title: How long will my piercing session last?
question5.description: The piercing process itself is usually quite quick. The entire appointment, including consultation and aftercare instructions, may take 30-60 minutes.

question6.title: How do I care for my new piercing?
question6.description: We will provide you with detailed aftercare instructions specific to your piercing. Generally, this involves cleaning the piercing regularly with a saline solution and avoiding touching or rotating the jewelry unnecessarily.

question7.title: What is the healing process like?
question7.description: Healing times vary depending on the piercing type and individual.  We will give you an estimated healing timeframe. You may experience some initial redness, swelling, and tenderness.

question8.title: When can I change my jewelry?
question8.description: It is crucial to wait until your piercing is fully healed before changing the jewelry. Changing jewelry too soon can lead to complications. We can assist you with jewelry changes once your piercing is healed.

question9.title: Can I participate in sports or swimming with a new piercing?
question9.description: It's best to avoid swimming in pools, hot tubs, and other bodies of water until your piercing is fully healed.  Discuss any specific activities with your piercer for personalized advice.

question1.title: What are the different types of permanent makeup procedures?
question1.description: We offer a range of permanent makeup services, including microblading (for eyebrows), powder brows, ombre brows, eyeliner (lash line enhancement, classic liner, shaded liner), and lip color (lip liner, full lip tint). We can discuss which technique is best suited for your desired look.

question2.title: How do I prepare for my permanent makeup appointment?
question2.description: Avoid caffeine and alcohol 24 hours before your appointment. Do not take any blood-thinning medications or supplements without consulting your doctor. If you wear contact lenses, you may want to remove them before the procedure. Arrive with clean skin and no makeup on the area to be treated.

question3.title: Does permanent makeup hurt?
question3.description: ain tolerance varies. We use topical numbing creams to minimize discomfort during the procedure. Most clients report feeling minimal discomfort.

question4.title: How long does a permanent makeup procedure take?
question4.description: The duration varies depending on the procedure. Eyebrow procedures typically take 1-3 hours, while eyeliner and lip procedures may take less time.

question5.title: What happens during the permanent makeup procedure?
question5.description: We will review your desired look and pre-draw the design on your skin for your approval. A topical anesthetic will be applied. We will then use a specialized tool to implant pigment into the skin.

question6.title: What is the healing process like?
question6.description: The healing process typically takes 7-14 days.  You may experience some redness, swelling, and minor scabbing.  It is important to follow our aftercare instructions carefully.

question7.title: When can I see the final results?
question7.description: The final results of your permanent makeup will be visible after the healing process is complete.  The color may appear darker initially and will soften over time.

question8.title: How long does permanent makeup last?
question8.description: Permanent makeup is not truly permanent. It will fade over time due to factors like sun exposure, skin type, and lifestyle. Touch-ups are recommended every 1-3 years to maintain the desired color and shape.

items.item1: Refrain from alcohol consumption: Please avoid alcohol for 24 hours prior to your tattoo. Even small amounts can thin your blood, potentially increasing discomfort and affecting the healing process.
items.item2: Avoid blood-thinning medications: Do not take pain relievers such as Advil or Tylenol before your appointment, as they can also thin your blood.  If you are taking any prescribed medications, please consult with your doctor and inform us beforehand.
items.item3: Rest and nourish your body: A good night's sleep and a substantial meal before your tattoo are essential.  Think of it as preparing for a physically demanding activity; your body will appreciate the support.
items.item4: Prepare the tattoo area: Shaving and moisturizing the area to be tattooed the night before can significantly improve the tattooing process. Please ensure the area is clean and free from any irritations.
items.item5: Childcare arrangements: For safety and focus during your tattoo session, we kindly request that you make arrangements for childcare and refrain from bringing small children or babies to the studio.
items.item6: Comfortable attire: Wear comfortable clothing that allows easy access to the area being tattooed.
items.item7: Entertainment: Feel free to bring a book, headphones, or other forms of entertainment to help pass the time during your session.
items.item8: Refreshments: Bring drinks and snacks, you probably won't have enough time during short breaks to get food.
items.item9: Personal comfort: You are welcome to bring a personal pillow for added comfort during your tattoo.
items.item10: Flexible scheduling: Please avoid scheduling appointments immediately after your tattoo session, as appointment times can occasionally vary. This will allow for a relaxed and unhurried experience.

items.item1: Initial Bandage Removal: Leave the bandage on for a minimum of 3 hours and no longer than 12 hours. Remove it under warm, running water, gently and slowly to avoid irritating the tattoo.
items.item2: Cleansing: After removing the bandage, lightly wash the tattooed area with your hand and unscented soap.
items.item3: Drying: Gently pat the area dry with a soft, clean towel and allow it to air dry for 5-10 minutes.
items.item4: Ointment Application: For the first two days, apply a thin layer of A+D ointment, especially after showering.
items.item5: Lotion Application: After the first two days, switch to an unscented hand lotion. Apply it 3-4 times daily for 10-14 days, or until the tattoo is completely finished peeling.
items.item6: Peeling: Between days 3 and 6, your tattoo will begin to flake, similar to a sunburn.  Do not pick or scratch these flakes. Allow the skin to peel naturally. Some flakes may come off during washing or lotion application, even if they contain color. 1  This is normal; it is simply the top, dead layer of skin shedding.

items.item1: Bandage Duration: Leave the adhesive film bandage on for a maximum of 3 days.
items.item2: Removal: Remove the bandage under warm running water by gently pulling at a corner. Stretching the film is more effective than peeling it back.
items.item3: Cleansing: After removing the bandage, wash the tattoo thoroughly with your hand and unscented soap.
items.item4: Drying: Gently pat the tattoo dry with a clean towel and allow it to air dry for 5-10 minutes.
items.item5: Lotion/Salve Application: Apply a thin layer of unscented lotion or a non-petroleum jelly-based salve 3-4 times daily for 10-14 days, or until the tattoo is fully peeled.

items.item1: No Re-bandaging: Do not re-bandage your tattoo.
items.item2: Sun Protection: Keep your tattoo out of direct sunlight for 2-3 weeks. After that, always apply sunscreen to protect it from fading.
items.item3: Avoid Picking/Scratching: Do not pick or scratch at the peeling skin.
items.item4: No Soaking: Avoid soaking your tattoo for two weeks. This includes swimming, baths, hot tubs, and saunas.
items.item5: No Shaving/Waxing: Do not shave or wax the tattooed area until it is fully healed.
items.item6: Avoid Certain Products: Do not apply alcohol, Vaseline, petroleum jelly, or sunblock to a fresh tattoo.
items.item7: Limit Exercise: Avoid strenuous exercise that directly affects the tattooed area for the first two weeks.
items.item8: Follow Professional Advice: Adhere to the aftercare instructions provided by your artist. If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us. We are always happy to assist you.

items.item1: Your Responsibility: Once you leave the studio, the proper care of your tattoo becomes your responsibility.
items.item2: Minor Color Transfer: Some minor color may appear on clothing or bedding during the first few days. This is normal.

ArtistForms.click_to_add_new_artist: Click to add a new artist

Services.tattoo_is: A tattoo is a permanent form of body art. A tattoo design is made by puncturing the top layer of the skin with needles and injecting ink, dyes, and pigments into the deeper layers.
Services.tattoo_procedure_1: The tattoo artist will wash his or her hands with antibacterial soap and water and wear clean, fresh gloves (and possibly a surgical mask) to ensure a safe and clean environment. The area which will be tattooed is washed with soap and shaved, if necessary before the artist draws or stencils the design on your skin.
Services.tattoo_procedure_2: Once you are happy with the design, the area is cleaned once more, and a thin layer of ointment is applied. The actual process of tattooing normally begins with outlines and moves on from there. The artist may use different needles during the process depending upon the desired design, and the style of the artist. Any fluids from the tattoo are wiped away with a sterile and disposable gauze or towel. Once the tattoo is finished the area is cleaned once more and a sterile bandage is applied.
Services.does_it_hurt_tattoo: Does It Hurt to Get a Tattoo?
Services.tattoo_hurt_answer: Getting a tattoo feels different for everyone. The pain will vary in type and intensity depending on your pain threshold, the location of the tattoo, and the type of tattoo you are getting.
Services.body_piercing_1: A piercing is a hole or puncture of sorts made by a needle through a layer of tissue that jewelry is able to fit through and safely remain while the piercing heals. Many people pierce their noses, ears, lips, or naval, but piercing comes in many forms and styles from oral piercings, to surface anchor pieces embedded into the skin.
Services.body_piercing_2: If you are 18 years of age or older please bring a valid government-issued photo ID such as a state ID, driver's license, or passport. A learner's permit is not a valid ID.
Services.body_piercing_3: If you are a minor (14-17 yrs old) we require your birth certificate and one of your parent's valid photo IDs. For guardians of minors, we require a court-issued statement that you are the legal guardian.
Services.body_piercing_procedure_1: The licensed piercer will wash his or her hands with antibacterial soap and water and wear clean, fresh gloves to ensure a clean and sterile environment. The area to be pierced (except for the tongue which is cleaned with a form of Listerine) is cleaned with alcohol or another type of antiseptic. All needles and equipment used are fully sterilized prior to the procedure.
Services.body_piercing_procedure_2: Your skin is then punctured with a very sharp, sterile, single-use needle, and the sterile jewelry is then placed into the hole created. The piercing is then cleaned of any blood, and you will receive aftercare instructions.
Services.permanent_makeup_is: Permanent makeup is a form of cosmetic tattooing in which a tattoo machine is used to inject pigment and ink into the skin to change the coloration of the desired area. Permanent makeup artists have all the skills of the average makeup artist and are able to produce the same look as real makeup, but with permanent results. Eyeliner, color enhancement of skin on the face, eyelids, lips, and eyebrows are common for permanent makeup, but we also offer many other services to make you look and feel your best. Please contact us for more information, specifics, and availability.
Services.permanent_makeup_benefits_text: The most obvious beauty benefit to permanent makeup is waking up every day with your face always ‚Äúon‚Äù. You can go for a swim, exercise, shower and wake up still looking put together and ready to go. You never have to take time to do your makeup or worry about taking it off. For many, it is a great way to free up precious time.
